main event: On August 8, 1966, a local resident in Donnybrook, North Dakota reported observing a circular object hovering about 100 feet above the ground, which emitted a bright light and then rapidly accelerated away.
interesting points: The object was described as approximately 30 to 40 feet in diameter, metallic in appearance, and hovering silently., Witnesses reported seeing similar bright lights in the area around the same time., The object's characteristics included changing color and emitting a glowing light., The investigation by Project Blue Book concluded that the case remains unidentified due to lack of evidence., Major H. Semons and other officials attempted to investigate further, but no physical evidence was found.
sighted object: circular disc-shaped object emitting bright light
witness description: A local resident who observed the object from about 100 feet away.
